meanings.definition: Feel distressed or humiliated due to a failure or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he chagrinned and walked off the field sadly.
meanings.sent2: She chagrinned when her presentation didn't go as planned.
meanings.sent3: The cat chagrinned when it couldn't catch the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: His chagrinned expression spoke volumes about his defeat.
meanings.sent5: The student's chagrinned face showed his disappointment in his test score.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel distressed or humiliated.
meanings.sent1: The harsh criticism chagrinned her deeply.
meanings.sent2: His thoughtless comment chagrinned his friend at the party.
meanings.sent3: The prank chagrinned him, but he couldn't help but laugh later.
meanings.sent4: The failure of the project chagrinned the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing mistake chagrinned the speaker in front of the audience.
